result.execSummary:
The defendant Leah L Gauer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Leah L Gauer is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Leah L Gauer was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Leah L Gauer in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Crystal Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  Information filed, reading waived.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled no contest to Ct. 1.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Ct. 2 dismissed.  On Ct. 1 Court withheld sentencing placed defendant on probation for 2 years.  Conditions of probation include: AODA and comply, submit DNA sample, $518.00 costs, 30 days in jail, with Huber for work and childcare, consecutive to any other sentence.  Jail start on 02/13/16  7:00 pm.  6 month review.  No credit.

Defendant Leah L Gauer in court, in custody with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing requested by atty Riek.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 09:00 am.
